question.title: Why 'libs' is not available in the conventions plugin gradle kotlin?
question.body:
I am using gradle 8.8 version with kotlin.

I have the next strcuture of the project:

root
|
\ **buildSrc**
   |
   \src/main/kotlin/**build.test-conventions.gradle.kts**
   |
   \ build.gradle.kts
   \ settings.gradle.kts
\ gradle
   |
   \ wrapper
   \ **libs.versions.toml**
...

In libs.versions.toml I have som version declaration:

[versions]
test-version=1.0.0

[libraries]
some-lib = { module = "..", version.ref="test-version" }
...

In settings.gradle.kts I have link to the toml file like:

dependencyResolutionManagement {
  versionCatalogs {
    create("libs") {
      from(files("../gradle/libs.versions.toml"))
    }
  }
}

And I still cannot use

dependencies {
  implementation(libs.some.lib)
}

because libs is not available for me in build.test-conventions.gradle.kts though it's available in /buildSrc/build.gradle.kts. I tried the same with groovy and it works. libs is available there. Why?

Documentation that I followed: https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/version_catalogs.html https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/custom_plugins.html

I tried:

  1. Add dependencyResolutionManagement in settings.gradle.kts
  2. Do the same with groovy instead of kotlin

I am excpecting: libs notation will be available for any of my convention plugins under /buildSrc/../kotlin/ directory
